description:
runtime/race: update runtime to r183644
This revision properly handles memory range accesses.
Fixes issue 4453.
Fixes issue 5654.

messages.text: Can you add a note to the CL description saying where to get the sources that you used to build the object and how you built it?  r183418 unfortunately doesn't say much to me.  Thanks.
I will add linux and windows runtime tomorrow. But since there is nothing to look at in these binary files, I guess I can mail it now.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://dvyukov%40google.com@code.google.com/p/go/

On Thu, Jun 6, 2013 at 9:17 PM,  <iant@golang.org> wrote:
> Can you add a note to the CL description saying where to get the sources
> that you used to build the object and how you built it?  r183418
> unfortunately doesn't say much to me.  Thanks.


That's described in src/pkg/runtime/race/README

On 2013/06/06 15:48:38, dvyukov wrote:
> I will add linux and windows runtime tomorrow. But since there is nothing to
> look at in these binary files, I guess I can mail it now.

Could you generate the sysos?

On Wed, Jun 12, 2013 at 12:12 AM,  <remyoudompheng@gmail.com> wrote:
> On 2013/06/06 15:48:38, dvyukov wrote:
>>
>> I will add linux and windows runtime tomorrow. But since there is
>
> nothing to
>>
>> look at in these binary files, I guess I can mail it now.
>
>
> Could you generate the sysos?

I have issues with my windows machine. I am working on resolving them.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=59ac1b0cc342 ***

runtime/race: update runtime to r183644
This revision properly handles memory range accesses.
Fixes issue 4453.
Fixes issue 5654.
